    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AnimationLoader
    The AnimationLoader class loads a sprite sheet and manages character animations for different movement states (idle, walking) and directions (front, right, left, back).
    CollisionHandler
    Handles collision detection for an entity against objects in a TiledMap.
    DialogueUI
    Manages and displays NPC dialogue with a typewriter effect.
    Direction
    Enum representing the possible movement directions for both NPCs and the player in the game.
    Entity
    Abstract class representing an in-game entity with a texture, position, and collision box.
    GameDataHandler
    The GameDataHandler class manages loading and saving game data (such as player information, NPCs, and volume) from and to a JSON file.
    GameLauncher
    Main entry point of the game that sets a custom cursor and initializes the main menu screen.
    GameManager
    The GameManager class is responsible for managing game state, player data, and game settings.
    GameScreen
    Represents the game screen where gameplay occurs.
    Guard
    Abstract class representing a Guard, which is a type of NPC in the game.
    Guard.Guard1
    Represents a specific type of Guard with its own sprite.
    Guard.Guard2
    Represents a specific type of Guard with its own sprite.
    InputHandler
    The InputHandler class handles user input for player movement.
    IntroGameUI
    The IntroGameUI class represents the user interface for the game's introduction sequence.
    IntroScreen
    Screen that displays the introductory user interface.
    Janitor
    Abstract class representing a Janitor, which is a type of NPC in the game.
    Janitor.Janitor1
    Represents a specific type of Janitor with its own sprite.
    JSONService
    Provides methods for serializing and deserializing objects to and from JSON using Gson.
    Lwjgl3Launcher
    Launches the desktop (LWJGL3) application.
    MainGameUI
    The MainGameUI class represents the user interface for the main game screen.
    MainMenuScreen
    Screen that displays the main menu of the game.
    MainMenuUI
    The MainMenuUI class handles the main menu screen of the game.
    MapHandler
    The MapHandler class manages the loading and rendering of layers in a TiledMap.
    NPC
    Represents an NPC (Non-Player Character) entity in the game.
    NPCFactory
    Factory class that creates and initializes NPCs (guards, students, teachers, janitors, pets) with movement behaviors and target positions.
    Pet
    Abstract class representing a Pet, which is a type of NPC in the game.
    Pet.Pet1
    Represents a specific type of Pet with its own sprite.
    Pet.Pet2
    Represents another specific type of Pet with its own sprite.
    Player
    Represents a player entity in the game.
    ScreenState
    Interface for managing screen transitions in the game.
    Serializable
    Used to group classes that can be serializable
    SoundManager
    Manages the background music, sound effects, and global volume settings for the game.
    SoundManager.Builder
    Builder class for constructing a SoundManager with a specific background music.
    StartupHelper
    Adds some utilities to ensure that the JVM was started with the -XstartOnFirstThread argument, which is required on macOS for LWJGL 3 to function.
    Student
    Abstract class representing a Student, which is a type of NPC in the game.
    Student.CollegeFemale1
    Represents a specific female college student with its own sprite.
    Student.CollegeFemale2
    Represents a specific female college student with its own sprite.
    Student.CollegeMale1
    Represents a specific male college student with its own sprite.
    Student.CollegeMale2
    Represents a specific male college student with its own sprite.
    Teacher
     
    Teacher.FemaleTeacher
    Represents a specific female teacher with its own sprite.
    Teacher.MaleTeacher
    Represents a specific male teacher with its own sprite.
    UI
    The UI class is an abstract class that serves as the base for all user interfaces in the game.
    WildCatScreen
    Abstract class representing a screen in the game that implements both the Screen and ScreenState interfaces.
